post_text: Thank you Rebecca's Mission!! We are so excited to distribute these books.
shared_text:
Rebecca's Mission
May 4 at 3:13 PM ·

Today, Rebecca’s Mission had the pleasure of traveling to Hope Community Charter School, in Camden to safely drop off books. The books were distributed when parents came to collect school materials for their children. If you are an educator or know of an educator whose school would benefit from our safe distribution program, please contact Rebecca’s Mission via Facebook Messenger or at info@rebeccasmission.org. In the meantime, keep reading!

post_text:
If you need Internet Access PLEASE see below.

Comcast is offering 2 free months for Internet Access through their program, Internet Essentials. Click the link below for additional information.

You may qualify if you:

Live in an area where Comcast Internet Service is available.
Are eligible for public assistance programs like the National School Lunch Program, housing assistance, Medicaid, SNAP, SSI, and others.
Have not subscribed to Comcast Internet within the last 90 days.
Have no outstanding debt to Comcast that is less than one year old.

Signing up is easy and fast from your mobile device, go to: https://apply.internetessentials.com

Hope Community Charter School comenzará el aprendizaje remoto a partir del lunes 16 de marzo de 2020. Los maestros comunicarán a la familia de cada estudiante el horario y las actividades para el aprendizaje.

La oficina principal estará abierta de 9 am a 4 pm de lunes a viernes, disponible para brindar apoyo a nuestras familias. Comuníquese con la oficina al 856-379-3448.

Continuaremos actualizando a nuestras familias sobre cualquier cambio o actualización de nuestro horario actual.

¡Gracias!

post_text:
Hope Community Charter School will begin remote learning beginning, Monday, March 16, 2020. The teachers will be communicating to each student's family the schedule and activities for learning.

The main office will be open from 9am-4pm Monday through Friday, available for support for our families. Please contact office at 856-379-3448.

We will continue to update our families on any changes or updates to our current schedule.

Thank you!

post_text: Thank you Rebecca's Mission!!
shared_text:
Rebecca's Mission
December 17, 2019 at 8:31 AM ·

Rebecca’s Mission’s first bookmobile event was a success! Thank you Hope Community Charter School for allowing us to be a part of your wonderful community. And thank you to 6abc Action News for taking the time to tell our story. We wish everyone a happy holiday. We hope you enjoy time with family, friends, and a good book. Keep on reading!

post_text: Did you know??? HOPE received the honor of becoming a KINDNESS CERTIFIED SCHOOL. School Districts are chosen for their positive and proactive approach to improving school climate and increasing student engagement. Hope offers Social Emotional Learning as part of their curriculum. Hope Community Charter is creating an ongoing culture of kindness. We demonstrate a commitment to fostering positive, caring, and a respectful school environment where all students thrive.
text: Did you know??? HOPE received the honor of becoming a KINDNESS CERTIFIED SCHOOL. School Districts are chosen for their positive and proactive approach to improving school climate and increasing student engagement. Hope offers Social Emotional Learning as part of their curriculum. Hope Community Charter is creating an ongoing culture of kindness. We demonstrate a commitment to fostering positive, caring, and a respectful school environment where all students thrive.

post_text: Our Girl Scout troop 30270 has been working hard at making our swap gifts and first aid kits for camp! Our swap this year will be these adorable quivers for bow and arrows! The girls worked hard as a team to assemble them. The other girls that are going on our overnight camping trip prepared individual first aid kits with Ms. Espada. We also had some girls help Mrs. Sanders putting up the cafeteria bulletin board!

A big welcome to Ms. Russaw, Hope's new Vice Principal. Ms. Russaw comes to Hope with over 15 years experience in the education field, excited for the school year!

Ms. Russaw is most looking forward to supporting all our families and students. Ms. Russaw can't wait to see the students thrive and have fun!

post_text:
Introducing the Hope Community Charter School 2019-2020 Teaching and Support Staff!

We kicked the school year off with our Annual Open House last night.

If you missed the Open House or are still looking for a spot for your child, we have limited openings! We are one of the highest performing schools in the City of Camden. Your child deserves the best!

Contact the school office for more info at 856-379-3448.

post_text: More pictures from our Washington, DC trip yesterday. They visited the Museum of Natural History, the Museum of American History, the Korean War Memorial, the World War II Memorial, as well as the Lincoln and Jefferson Memorials. They didn't even seem tired on the bus ride home, either!

post_text: Cub Scouts meet Thursday, January 25, 2018, immediately after dismissal. Pick up is at 5 pm in the cafeteria through the back gates. If your scout is not able to attend the meeting please call the school office.

post_text: Are you ready for some cookies? Sale begins Thursday. The cookie sale helps our Girl Scouts go on a year-end trip. Eat heartily!

post_text: School will be closed Monday, January 15th, in observance of MLK Day.

post_text: Due to the weather conditions Hope will have a two hour delay tomorrow- Tuesday, January 9th. Breakfast at 9:30am. School will begin at 9:50am. Please be safe.

post_text: Earning a Golden Ticket at Hope means that you have been at school learning every day. Golden Ticket holders for the month of November baked cookies with staff as a special treat for their hard work! Here are some pictures of our bakers. More pictures will follow. Wow, did they have fun!

post_text:
Literacy Night tonight at 5:15pm
Come out and learn about holiday traditions of different cultures and places. Enjoy mac & Cheese, chicken bites, and salad catered by Revolution Foods, Hope's food service. Looking forward to a great evening!
